Body:
Description: Hi All,

We created an OS image that appeared as a clone to the Endpoint Protector Client. This is causing agents on those PCs to not properly report into the server console. For instance, we'll only see 1 of the PCs created with that image in the console at a given time. How are PCs fingerprinted? I am hoping there is a way we can update however they've been fingerprinted, ie. reinstall, updating the serial number of the C drive etc., so that all the PCs can report into the console properly. Thank you!

What We've Learned Updated: •        What is the impact of the issue on your business? All clients are not reporting into the console. Failing to pickup policy updates, etc.
•        Who is affected by this issue? About 50 PCs that have been imaged.
•        What are the steps to reproduce? NA
•        Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried? We updated the serial number of the C drive on 1 PC and it seemed to help. Does EPP utilize the C drive Serial in any way?
•        When did this issue start? With the new images
•        Screen shots, logs, other artifacts, etc.
Next Steps Updated: Reached out to schedule a remote session with customer and awaiting customer response

2/12/2025

- Customer has requested to reschedule meeting for 2/13/2025

2/13/2025

- Customer did not use clone support setting in EPP because clone is not an actual clone image.

- Customer will uninstall normally using normal processes, if customer experiences problems they will use Zapp

- Silent uninstall of the EPP Client on Windows script given to customer 

- Customer will attempt to use advised process to remove software from clone

- Customer created a snapshot of EPP server and applied Product Functionality update/ Netwrix EPP 5.9.4.1, EPP currently at 5.9.3.0

- EPP upgrade completed successfully to 5.9.4.1
Next Steps Updated: Customer will attempt to remove EPP client on clone machine and will reach out if he experiences any issues
